item.title: PHP Regex
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“belbn, post:3, topic:238101”]nope :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2008, 06:23:35 pm[/size][hr]I guess im just out of my mind because what i had earlier just worked.
preg_match_all(’|

(.*?)
|si’,$result,$match);[/quote]No, that’s PHP for you. is_file will work when it wants to, as well.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Regex
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

[quote=“Zachera, post:4, topic:238101”][php]<?php
$file = file(“http://www.example.com/”);
foreach($file as $val){
if(preg_match(’/

(.+)</div>/i’,$val,$match)){
echo $match[1].’
’;
}
}
?>[/php]

Maybe this will be of use.[/quote]

Thanks anyway, I didnt need the function just the regex.

Read full topic

[php]<?php
$file = file(“http://www.example.com/”);
foreach($file as $val){
if(preg_match(’/

(.+)</div>/i’,$val,$match)){
echo $match[1].’
’;
}
}
?>[/php]

item.title: PHP Regex
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

I want to take HTML tags and echo them and whats inside them for example right now im using,

preg_match_all(’|<div[^>]>(.?)|si’,$result,$match);

which gives me all divs in an array and i pick which one i want but i want to specify

contenthere

preg_match_all(’|

(.*?)
|si’,$result,$match);

doesnt work what’s the problem?, regex confuses the shit out of me

Read full topic
